name: Lorraine Hansberry (1930-05-19 – 1965-01-12)
bio: Lorraine Hansberry was a groundbreaking African-American playwright and writer, best known for her play *A Raisin in the Sun*, which depicted the struggles and aspirations of a Black family in Chicago. She was the first African-American woman to have a play performed on Broadway and the youngest American playwright to win the New York Drama Critics' Circle Award.
